meanings.definition: The act of settling or establishing in a new place.
meanings.sent1: After the flood, the government organized a resettlement for the affected families.
meanings.sent2: The resettlement of refugees in the camp was a challenging task for the aid workers.
meanings.sent3: The resettlement of the ants to a new anthill caused quite a buzz in the insect community.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like a resettlement, finding a new place to call home after years of wandering.
meanings.sent5: The resettlement of the puzzle pieces on the board brought a sense of completion to the game.

meanings.definition: The process of moving people to a new location to live.
meanings.sent1: The government initiated a resettlement to relocate the villagers from the flood-prone area.
meanings.sent2: Resettlement of the nomadic tribe was necessary due to the changing weather patterns.
meanings.sent3: The resettlement of the penguins to a warmer climate made them waddle with joy.
meanings.sent4: In her mind, the idea of starting a new life felt like a resettlement to a better future.
meanings.sent5: The resettlement of the seeds from the packet to the soil marked the beginning of a new garden.
